Title: Jehovah’s Witness cancer patient, Aunty Esther, dies after transfusion controversy
Summary: Mensah Omolola, better known on X as AuntieEsther, has died after battling breast cancer . News of her death surfaced on Saturday night after Auntymuse (@AUNTYMUSE_) reacted to a post announcing her passing .

Title: Arteta salutes injury-hit Arsenal’s survival spirit
Summary: Arsenal beat Brighton 2-1 in their Premier League clash on Saturday . The Gunners were rocked by an injury to Dutch defender Jurrien van Persie . Arteta praised Arsenal's refusal to let their title challenge be ruined by injuries .

Title: Nollywood actress, producer, Allwell Ademola, is dead
Summary: Ademola died on Saturday, December 27, in Lagos . Her death was confirmed by fellow actress Faithia Williams, who shared the news on Instagram .

Title: Work with Ijebu for new state, Akpabio tells Remo people
Summary: Senator Godswill Akpabio urges people of Remoland to strengthen unity and cooperation with their Ijebu kinsmen . He described harmony as essential to the realisation of the collective aspiration .

Title: Yuletide: Akpabio distributes fishing boats to riverine women in Akwa Ibom
Summary: Senate President Godswill Akpabio distributed outboard engine fishing boats to women and cooperative societies in the Eket Senatorial District . The empowerment initiative was carried out on Boxing Day .

Title: Fans slam Eagles defence after Tunisia scare
Summary: Nigeria’s defensive vulnerabilities dominated post-match discussions despite the Super Eagles’ 3–2 victory over Tunisia . Goals from Victor Osimhen, Wilfried Ndidi and Ademola Lookman put Nigeria firmly in control, but a chaotic closing spell saw Tunisia score twice late on, exposing persistent issues at the back .

Title: Abuja Declaration: 24 years later, Nigeria’s health budget still below 15%
Summary: The Federal Government has allocated N2.48 trillion to the health sector in the proposed 2026 budget . The allocation falls far short of the 15 per cent commitment outlined in the 2001 Abuja Declaration . Experts urge the Federal Government to prioritise health funding as a matter of national development and security .

Title: Choosing survival over tradition, women turn to modern contraceptives
Summary: Many Nigerian women are decisively setting aside long-held cultural and religious beliefs to embrace modern family planning methods . The World Health Organisation says family planning allows people to attain their desired number of children, determine the spacing of pregnancies, and make informed choices about sexual and reproductive health .

Title: Yuletide: Overeating may trigger heart attack, experts tell Nigerians
Summary: Medical experts warn against excessive eating during and after the yuletide . Overeating can lead to non-communicable diseases such as heart attack, cancer, diabetes, obesity, and hypertension . The experts warned that overeating can trigger discomfort and worsen long-term health conditions .

Title: Gender equality not battle between men, women – Executive Director, Invictus Africa
Summary: Executive Director of Invictus Africa, Bukky Shonibare, tells AYOOLA OLASUPO how the civic-tech organisation is using data to push for real gender equality across Nigeria . He says the biggest misconception is that the effort to achieve gender equality is seen as a battle between men and women .
